hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Solana Open Interest Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: In BEAR regimes, when SOL price makes a lower low but aggregate futures open interest (all exchanges) forms a higher low over 3 days, a transition to NEUTRAL regime follows within 5 trading days, with SOL outperforming BTC by 5%+ in that window.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Divergence between price (lower low) and OI (higher low) in a bear market suggests accumulation and weakening selling pressure. SOL, as a high-beta proxy for altcoin risk appetite, often leads regime shifts.
entry_conditions: SOL aggregate futures OI 3-day: higher low

exit_conditions.take_profit: SOL/BTC ratio increases by 5% OR regime transitions to NEUTRAL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: OI divergence fails to predict regime shift within 8 days more than 35% of the time, or SOL continues to underperform BTC.
